user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 8.13 is: A pointer should point to a const-qualified type whenever possible.

</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of OS_FdSet_ConvertOut_Impl:
```c
static void OS_FdSet_ConvertOut_Impl(fd_set *OS_set, OS_FdSet *OSAL_set)
{
    size_t       offset;
    size_t       bit;
    osal_index_t id;
    uint8        objids;
    int          osfd;

    for (offset = 0; offset < sizeof(OSAL_set->object_ids); ++offset)
    {
        objids = OSAL_set->object_ids[offset];
        bit    = 0;
        while (objids != 0)
        {
            id = OSAL_INDEX_C((offset * 8) + bit);
            if ((objids & 0x01) != 0 && id < OS_MAX_NUM_OPEN_FILES)
            {
                osfd = OS_impl_filehandle_table[id].fd;
                if (osfd < 0 || !FD_ISSET(osfd, OS_set))
                {
                    OSAL_set->object_ids[offset] &= ~(1 << bit);
                }
            }
            ++bit;
            objids >>= 1;
        }
    }
}
```
</target_code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: Only pointer occurrences in this function are the parameter OS_set and its use in FD_ISSET. OSAL_set must remain non-const because the function modifies OSAL_set->object_ids (e.g. objids = OSAL_set->object_ids[offset]; and OSAL_set->object_ids[offset] &= ~(1 << bit);), so it is not a candidate for const-qualification. Other identifiers (offset, bit, id, objids, osfd, OS_impl_filehandle_table[id].fd) are not pointer parameters that could be const-qualified here, or they are used for modification/assignment and thus are not applicable to Rule 8.13. Therefore only the OS_set parameter and its use should be investigated for possible const-qualification.
